column66: aka: https://radissonfortgeorgebelize.hotelwifi.com/admin --- changed on 04/04/2024   10/10/2023 - In this trip we change the APs on Colonial and Club bldg. and we start installing the APs in Villa Bldg. Now we have H550 in the rooms.  ---Colonial and Club--- -We replace the APs and now we have H550 on the rooms.  ---Villa Bldg.--- -We install H550 for the Gust rooms. -R350 in the hallway and some common areas. We remove these APs from Colonial and Club (Guest Rooms) to install the new APs H550 and we take all the R350 to villa bldg. (Hallway and Common areas) -4th Floor Guest room and Hallway. (Done)             Except Room 3301   (Room not ready) -3rd Floor Guest room and Hallway. (Done)             Except Room 3401   (Room not ready) -2nd Floor Hallway. (Done)  ---Pending Task (Villa bldg.)--- -5th Floor. -2nd Floor. -1st Floor. -Outdoor APs. -MDF (We need relocate the MDF from Colonial to Villa) -We need Install all the switches in the IDFs and put everything online.  Note: -Once they have Villa bldg. READY they going to start the remodeling in Colonial and Club bldg. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 2022 --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The Guest Wifi network consist of 1- MDF and 3 IDF's, the Core switch and the IDF switches all have the following Vlans configured: Vlan100 - Management Vlan200 - Guest Wifi Vlan201 - No portal page Vlan202 - Radisson Staff only Vlan203 - HardWired (Future install) Vlan300 - Security Camera (Future install) Vlan400 - IP Phones (Future install) Vlan500 - IPTV (Future install) Vlan800 - Admin Network (Please note that the network does not have a DHCP server, all connections have a static iP.) Vlan900 - ISP Uplink (only configured in the CoreSW)  The ISP is a Fiber handoff to our CoreSW, Vlan 900 is distributing the Public IP's to our fusion, Mikrotik GW, Oracle PMS server, Ubiquity GW (no longer used), We have all the IDF's connected to the CoreSW via LC/LC fiber.  All fiber ports in the IDF have been setup for 10G connection and the fiber in Mod 2 on the CoreSW has been also setup for 10G connection. In this MDF there is a 3com unmanaged admin SW this switch connects all the Admin networks and printers in the colonial building accept for accounting, restaurant computers and the security office.     IDF 2  is located in the 2nd Floor Executive office, this IDF supports all the Guest room AP's in floors 1-3 and Terrace AP's (T310).  This IDF also supports all the common AP's on the first floor like the lobby.  The Guest room AP's are mounted vertically on the wall just under the ceiling facing towards the back of the room.  All ethernet connections in the guest rooms were installed using outdoor Cat 6 ethernet cable but the termination ends were standard cat 6 connectors.  IDF3 is located in the clubhouse, these guest rooms have ethernet cable only in the x22 and x24 rooms from the 1st floor to the 6th floor.  The AP's are mounted in the guest room vertically under the ceiling. We have an AP's in front of the Elevator on every floor of the clubhouse.    IDF4 is located in the Accounting office which supports the AP's in the Restaurant St. George, The Tavern, Pool area, Balcony for the Tavern, Accounting and the security office.  In this IDF there is a 3com unmanaged admin SW this switch connects all the Admin networks and printers in the accounting, restaurant computers and the security office.    Please note if the hotel requires the admin network via Wifi the SSID to use is Radisson OPS, now the device that will be using this SSID will need a Static IP address.  This is the IP scope for the Admin network. 10.36.239.x 255.255.255.128 10.36.239.254  dns 10.36.239.131 8.8.8.8
column67: MDF is located in the 2nd Floor of the colonial Building in the Executive office. The Fusion, CoreSW, and the Mikrotik GW are mounted and connected in the Full Rack.  All equipment are connected to the Tripp Lite 2200.  Please note there is no watt box at this property.  IDF 2 is also located in the 2nd floor of the colonial building in the executive office.  Equipment has been installed into an enclosed 12U Rack on the wall in the MDF.  The equipment in the rack are connected to a tripp lite 1500 UPS.  IDF3 is located on the 3rd floor of the clubhouse in a storage room near the elevator.  Equipment has been installed on a 9U wedge rack, and connected to a Tripp Lite 1500 UPS  IDF 4 is located in the Accounting office which is located in the basement.  Please note there is a door to access the basement, the code is 0722.  This access door is in front of the St. George restaurant.  Go thru the accounting office and the IDF is located in a Storage room.  The equipment is connected to a APC 850 UPS.  The Guest room AP's are mounted vertically on the wall just under the ceiling facing towards the back of the room

column68: The ISP no longer connects directly to the Fusion.  ISP is now connected to port 13 on Core switch which is untagged vlan 900 "WAN".  VLAN 801 - The hotel's restaurant is now run by an outside company. Their onsite contact is Scott (scott@tiburontavern), otherwise can reach them through the GM, Gary. Initially, they installed a POS system called "TOAST" so they could use their handheld POS terminals in the restaurant only. The TOAST system installed consists of a Cisco GW, Core switch and two Ubiquity APs in the restaurant area. Recently, the restaurant decided they wanted coverage for their POS terminals on the 2nd floor patio (above the restaurant), the inside pool area patio and the pool itself. The IT company for Tiburon (CMIT Solutions of Central Rhode Island, contact: Zachary @ 401-586-6842), decided the best solution for these additional areas was to put the POS terminals SSID (TIBURON_TAVERN_SECURE, WPA2 PWD: toasty979931fa) on our APs that are facing the pool and patio areas. To do this, the TOAST Core switch port 14 is connected to Untagged VLAN 801 on port 10 on our Core switch (SW-MDF-1-01). VLAN 801 is TAG to the two switches (SW-IDF5-1-1 & SW-IDF6-2-1) that have APs covering the pool and patio areas. (their Cisco GW hands out this DHCP address pool: 192.168.192.xx/24 GW: 192.168.192.1). Currently, the TOAST SSID is deleted from the ZD due to the POS terminals are not getting out to the internet on our APs. The POS terminals can print to the kitchen locally but just cant get out to the internet via the TOAST GW - probably some blocking in the TOAST GW config.  WattBox Outlets Breakdown: 1. FUSION-PSU-1 2. FUSION-PSU-2 3. Core-SW 4. ZoneDirector 5. Empty

column66: This is a Guestcast only property where We do not manage the Network. The access to our server and VM are via Port Forward. column68: ********************************************************************************************* ******** IN CASE OF FUSION FAILURE MOVE TRAFFIC OVER MIKROTIK ******* ********************************************************************************************** 1. Use Winbox software to log into the Mikrotik 206.74.80.228 (admin/GsquidPineapplejelly7&) 2. From the Mikrotik ssh into Core SW, Open New Terminal CLI: "system ssh user=your-radius-user 172.16.0.10 " ----- and the PW: your-radius-password 3. Once on the CoreSW, disable the SW port when the Fusion-LAN2 (port 1/1/24) is to ensure it won't be traffic over the Fusion. 4. On the IP menu, select the submenu Addresses, then select "MGMT172.16.1.254/23-VLAN-100" and change the IP address from 172.16.1.254/23 to 172.16.0.1/23 5. Enable all the VLANs under the Interfaces menu under the VLAN tab. 6. Select the submenu Addresses List on the IP menu and enable all the Addresses. 7. Select the submenu DHCP Server on the IP menu and enable all the DHCP servers.  Notes: - These are the VLANs currently configured in the Mikrotik: 100, 101, 200, 201, 221-500, 800 -In case a local connection is needed on the Mikrotik, please use ETH5/Local, make your PC static on 192.168.88.100/24, then type this IP 192.168.88.1 on the browser. **************************************************************************************************

column68: IF FUSION FAIL MOVE THE TRAFFIC OVER MIKROTIK: -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 1. Login into the Mikrotik via WinBox. WAN/Eth1 is connected to a Core-SW 2. From the Mikrotik do SSH into CoreSW, run: system / ssh 172.16.66.10 user=admin" ----- and use the PW: SsquidPineapplejelly7& 3. Once on the CoreSW, disable the SW ports where the Fusion LAN to make sure it won't be traffic over the Fusion. 4. Enable all the VLANs under the Interfaces menu under the VLAN tab (VLAN 200, 801, 802, 810). 5. On the IP menu, select the submenu Addresses, then select the interface "ETH2/LAN" and change the IP address from 172.16.66.254/24 to 172.16.66.1/24 6. Select the submenu DHCP Server on the IP menu and enable all the DHCP servers.  Decyphertech manages the admin network. They will receive calls from the hotel staff and reach out to HIS for any guest network issues. The best way to reach them is via projectmanagement@decyphertech.com.   For any GPON related issues, please open a ticket with Qypsys by emailing: helpdesk@qypsys.com  Jennifer Jones was the IT consultant for this project: Phone Number : 310-383-6942  The ISP is Comcast  WattBox outlets mapping: --------------------------------- Outlet-1: Firewall Outlet-2: Switch 01 MDF Outlet-3: Switch 02 MDF Outlet-4: Switch 03 MDF Outlet-5: Unknown PC, Not Decypher device Outlet-6: DATTO Outlet-7: ESXI Server Outlet-8: Haymax Corp Old server 1 Outlet-9: Haymax Corp Old server 2 Outlet-10: Mikrotik-IPTV-System Outlet-11: Empty Outlet-12: Empty  **** 03/26/2025 **** They contracted the Comcast IPTV services. Comcast installed a new dedicated circuit that we connected to the Fusion WAN1 with IP 50.169.252.218/30. The VLAN 3982 was created to provide DHCP for the guestroom devices (X1). The Juniper box (dedicated circuit) is connected to port 1/1/16 of the core switch and is configured in VLAN 950.

column66: This site is a Positron Gh-n install with Coax GAMs. There are 2 GAMs, one on the second floor near the GM's office on the wall and the other on the second floor in the storage closet between 219 and 220. Each GAM has 4 ports, and only 3 are used. An RG 6 cable connects each port to an 8-way splitter. The room drops are combined using a 12dB directional coupler with the DSS TV feed to the end devices, uplinking Unleashed R350s in guest rooms. Two R650s and two R550s are also installed in Public Areas using Unleashed. The Master AP is the Lobby AP at 172.16.0.32; the secondary is the MDF AP located on the 3rd floor IDF1 mix point and DSS head end.    We were provided an ISP-WAN-Block /30 to be Routed on the CoreSW to make the ISP-LAN-Block /29 available. So CoreSW has an IP on the WAN-Block vlan 902, another on LAN-Block VLAN 901, and also an IP on the WiFi-MGMT vlan 100. See the Equipment list for details.  Guest WiFi Client Experience: *Open SSID: VLAN200 "bwhooverdam" takes the clients to a Portal Page with Access Code: Welcome1 *WPA2 SSID VLAN201 (directv2025): Directv is hidden to provide WiFi to the DirecTV STB. They require WiFi with Internet access to make internal apps and features work. *WAP2 SSID VLAN300 (bwmeeting2025): BW-Meeting is a visible one that provides WiFi for meeting events.
column67: MDF is in an office behind the front desk. The Rack is in the far righthand corner of the office as you come in the door. Located in the rack from top to bottom are Cox Fiber Nokia device that feeds into our Core Switch on dry VLAN 902 and then out to a Netgear switch; another /30 WAN block feeds the Camera system. The MikroTik Router board is mounted above the core switch and the WAN is in VLAN901 on port 1/1/1. The MikrTik LAN is connected to port 1/1/2. The Fusion is mounted below the Core Switch WAN1 on port 1/1/24 and LAN1 on port 1/2/2. IPMI is connected to port 1/1/22. The Web Power Switch is mounted on the wall behind the rack and connected to port 1/1/21.  IDF1 is on the 2nd floor near the Elevator. The door has a card-key lock and leads to the GM's office. On the wall on the Left side, you will find GAM1-IDF1-2-01. There are 3 port feeds on RG6 coax going to the 2nd distribution mix on the wall across from the GAM to an eight-way splitter. The other 2 ports go up to the 3rd floor and down to the first-floor distribution mix to eighth-way splitters as well.   IDF2 is located on the 2nd floor of Storage between 219 and 220. The door has a keypad lock. Inside, in the back, on the right side of the room, is GAM2. The same setup was done for this side of the hotel. Each distribution point on the 1st, 2nd, and 3rd floors [stacking closets] has a feed on an RG6 coax to an eight-way splitter.

column67: The MDF(Fusion, SonicWALL, Brocade switch, Wattbox) is located in the second-floor service area by the parking garage elevator and the IDFs (Brocade switches) are located in the Sand Key Tower 4th floor at the end of the hallway in the opposite side of the elevator lobby, Gulf Tower 4th Floor near room 418, Gulf Tower second floor by  the meeting rooms and Camera Room CameraRoom SW-IDF-Camera_Room-1-01, SW-IDF-Camera_Room-1-02  In Outside box on the wall of Ladies Bathroom TiKi Bar area SW-IDF-Ladies_Restroom-1-01
column68: IF FUSION FAIL MOVE THE TRAFFIC OVER MIKROTIK: -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 1. Login into the Mikrotik via WinBox. WAN/Eth1 is connected to a Core-SW 2. From the Mikrotik do SSH into CoreSW, run: system / ssh 172.16.77.10 user=admin" ----- and use the PW: c0c01509hki! 3. Once on the CoreSW, disable the SW ports where the Fusion LAN1 and LAN2  to make sure it won't be traffic over the Fusion, notice LAN1 and LAN2 are in different SWs (172.16.77.10 and 172.16.77.23) both at MDF. 4. Enable all the VLANs under the Interfaces menu under the VLAN tab (VLAN 100, 200, 201, 270, 300, 301, 400, 800 to 803). 5. On the IP menu, select the submenu Addresses, then select the interface "ETH3/LAN2" and change the IP address from 172.16.77.254/24 to 172.16.77.1/24 6. Select the submenu DHCP Server on the IP menu and enable all the DHCP servers.  --------------------------------------------------------- ADMIN NETWORK - NO MANAGE BY US --------------------------------------------------------- They have a SonicWall connected to Ruckus switches with 5 different networks: VLAN 1 - Admin MGMT - 192.168.0.2/24 (71.41.47.194) VLAN 3 - POS - 192.168.2.254/24 (71.41.47.195) VLAN 4 - Security Cameras - 192.168.3.2/24 (71.41.47.196) VLAN 5 - Web Cameras - 192.168.4.2/24 (71.41.47.197) VLAN 7 - Business Admin - 192.168.1.2/24 (71.41.47.199)  Switches: Core Switch MDF 2nd Floor: 192.168.0.10 (SSH access on 71.41.47.194:52210) Switch 1 Security IDF 1st Floor: 192.168.0.11 Switch 2 Security IDF 1st Floor: 192.168.0.12 Switch 3 Security IDF 4th Floor: 192.168.0.13 Switch 4 Security IDF 4th Floor: 192.168.0.13 (Stack)  ATMs: ATMs untagged on vlan7 with Network 192.168.1.0/24, DG:192.168.1.1, native on SonicWall interface X3. ---ATM-Hotel static now on 192.168.1.50, connected to SW-IDF-Admin-04-1 192.168.1.50  port 1/1/2. ---ATM-Restaurant static now on 192.168.1.49, connected to SW-IDF-Admin-SEC-01-2   192.168.0.12  port 1/1/5.  The new Camera NVRs are installed in the Guest Network and we configured an interconnect through VLAN 9 to route the traffic from the NVRs to the Camera Viewing Apps that they use in multiple computers connected to the Business VLAN 7 network. The SonicWall does everything for the Admin network (routing, DHCP, NAT'ing...)  The Admin Network is managed by:  Dennis DeOcampo dennis@ouritsource.com (727) 242-3027 ------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------

column68: Pass the Traffic over Mikrotik if Fusion Fail ======================================================================================= Eth1 ---WAN ---- CoreSW, Port 1/1/39 Eth2 ----LAN ---- CoreSW, Port 1/1/40 1. Proceed to login into the Mikrotik. 2. Go to: Interfaces/Ethernet 3. Double click on ETH2 LAN 4. Select Enable 5. OK 6. Do ssh into the CoreSW through the Mikrotik and proceed to disable port 1/1/48 (Fusion-LAN2)--- recommended in case Fusion came back online.  There is one switch in the MDF labeled SW-IDF-Spare that could be used as a replacement for any IDF switch. There are wall jacks in the conference space that will not work.  Our technician that installed the site (Bill Sims) was not able to trace these ports back to any of the IDFs so the cables are likely cut.  The customer should be instructed to only use ports that are found in the conference tool as these are the only ports that will work. -Walter 9/26/19

column66: - This is a 25-story hotel, the hotel has a basement floor used as a parking garage, and on the 1st floor is located part of BOH and the valet parking. The second floor is used as a parking garage too, the MDF is located here. On the 3rd floor are located the FD, the pool, and the admin areas. The floor between the 5th and the 25th are guest floors.  This is a guestcast customer all TV's on the property are samsung 50" and 55", the guest cast device are connected to HDMI2 and powered via USB.  Guest cast server is located in the server room located in the Admin office. Guestcast are connected to HDMI2 and secured to the base of  the TV with a security cable.  The device is powered by using the USB port on the TV.  This site is not using Guestcast remotes but they are using Samsung remotes or Generic remotes with an input button.
column67: +MDF: -The MDF is located in the server room on the 2nd-floor garage. -The following devices are located on the MDF: Fusion gateway, Guestcast server, IoT Server, Mikrotik gateway, CoreSW and 2 more switches.  +IDFs: - There are 15 IDFs in the hotel, see below a list of their locations:       - On the 3rd floor there are 2 IDFs: one in the service elevator room and the other in the server room inside of the admin offices area.       - On the guest floor there are 11 IDFs, 4 on the East side, these ones are located in the service elevator room; and 7 on the West side, these ones are located on the housekeeping closet next to room X27.       - There is an IDF in the kitchen of the Coconut restaurant on the 21st floor.       - The last one is located on the roof, inside the elevator engine room.  +APs: -The APs in the common areas are installed on the basement, 1st, 2nd, and 3rd floor. See the name and network diagram for location reference. - APs for the guest room are installed on the closet next to the entry door.  Guestcast are connected to HDMI2 and secured to the base of  the TV with a security cable.  The device is powered by using the USB port on the TV.  This site is not using Guestcast remotes but they are using Samsung remotes or Generic remotes with an input button.
column68: - The network backbone of this hotel is a hybrid of 10G fiber and CAT6.  - The cables on the guest floors are running thru the lights soffit and penetrating the rooms by the closet next to the entry door. -The AP-LP26 is connected to the PoE-Out port of the AP-LP56. It's a daisy chain connection. -The hotel camera system is connected to our switch located on the IDF-Server room on the 3rd floor.  This is a guestcast customer all TV's on the property are samsung 50" and 55", the guest cast device are connected to HDMI2 and powered via USB.  Guest cast server is located in the server room located in the Admin office

column66: This is a Two Bldgs. property, separated by an street. Olive and Safari. The link between both is an underground Eth cable. We have Fusion as main Gateway and a Mikotik Backup Gateway... Notice that the Mikrotik was configured with the same Public Static IP address.   The link for the 2 IDFs is also Eth Cat6. All APs are power via POE.  Since 05/03/2024 we are running separated from Admin Network.
column67: MDF: Olive Bldg. 1st Floor Telef. Closet inside the Laundry room. Fusion, MikroTik, CoreSW, WattBox  IDF-1: Safari Bldg. 1st Floor. Telef. Closet inside the HK office. SW-IDF  IDF-2: Safari Bldg. 2nd Floor. Backside of the Bldg. Make sure to bring a ladder to access this IDF.    In both Bldgs. Coast Anabel Hotel and Safari Inn: With the new WiFi Upgrade most of the Guestroom APs were installed inside the rooms, except on rooms where no cable available.    Note: See Equipment List for details.  Safari Lobby AP is in the ceiling of the lobby.  The Safari Building get its internet connection from a TPlink SW that is located under the Front Desk in the Coast Annabelle Building.  The Switch provides internet for the Front desk and other devices like the printers.  We have a physical Ethernet cable that travels from the Annabelle to the Safari Housekeeping office.  This ISP Uplink ethernet cable which is located in the MDF/Laundry room of the Annabelle building.  The Switch under the Front desk of the Annabelle is connected to the Netgear router in the MDF, there are also Two ethernet cables that go from the Front desk Annabelle to the Safari Building House keeping office, we have two network Biscuit boxes labeled 8 and 9.  Ethernet Cable labeled 8 feeds the Admin network at the safari Inn.  Ethernet cable 9 feeds the Guest network that feeds the Safari Inn, where we ran a physical ethernet cable from the MDF Core SW and connected to the network biscuit labeled number 9.  The TPlink SW under the Front Desk at the Annabelle is unmanaged and it is also a 10/100/1000 SW.
column68: ****** Disaster Recovery ******** ******************************************** *** IN CASE OF FUSION FAILURE *** ********************************************  1. Disconnect FUSION WAN1 UPLINK from the Brocade CoreSW  CA-Olive-CoreSW-MDF-01  172.16.84.10  port 1/2/1 (X1) 2. Connect ETH cable from Core SW CA-Olive-CoreSW-MDF-01 172.16.84.10 port 1/1/44 (44) to WAN MikroTik --- This cable was left already connected to the MiktoTik, just need to be connected to port 44 on CoreSW 3.Use Winbox software to log into the Mikrotik, use Piblic IP  199.48.123.66 (admin/GsquidPineapplejelly7&) 4. From the Mikrotik open a terminal session and ssh into Core SW, run: "system ssh 172.16.84.10 user=admin" ----- and use the PW: SsquidPineapplejelly7& 5. Once on the CoreSW, disable the SW port where the Fusion-LAN (port 1/2/3) is to ensure it won't be traffic over the Fusion. 6. On the IP menu, select the submenu Addresses, then select the interface "Mgmt.172.16.84.254/24-VLAN-101" and change the IP address from 172.16.84.254/24 to 172.16.84.1/24 7. Enable all the VLANs under the Interfaces menu under the VLAN tab. 8. Select the submenu DHCP Server on the IP menu and enable all the DHCP servers.  Notes: - These are the VLANs currently configured in the Mikrotik: 100, 101, 200, 201, 202, 500 The Safari Building get its internet connection from a TPlink SW that is located under the Front Desk in the Coast Annabelle Building.  The Switch provides internet for the Front desk and other devices like the printers.  We have a physical Ethernet cable that travels from the Annabelle to the Safari Housekeeping office.  This ISP Uplink ethernet cable which is located in the MDF/Laundry room of the Annabelle building.  The Switch under the Front desk of the Annabelle is connected to the Netgear router in the MDF, there are also Two ethernet cables that go from the Front desk Annabelle to the Safari Building House keeping office, we have two network Biscuit boxes labeled 8 and 9.  Ethernet Cable labeled 8 feeds the Admin network at the safari Inn.  Ethernet cable 9 feeds the Guest network that feeds the Safari Inn, where we ran a physical ethernet cable from the MDF Core SW and connected to the network biscuit labeled number 9.  The TPlink SW under the Front Desk at the Annabelle is unmanaged and it is also a 10/100/1000 SW.

column66: This is a Ruckus network with a mix of HP and Ruckus switches and a virtual controller. There are a few admin unmanaged switches that we are sharing. Everything is connected via Cat5e, fiber or phone line.
column67: The FUSION, MicroTik and Core switch are in the MDF on A Deck in the Server Room behind the FD.  Decks are in order of top to bottom. Look at Network documentation and there are network photos to help locate each of the devices.   ~~Sports Deck~~ No devices on this deck. ~~Sun Deck~~  Sun Deck Exhibit electrical closet - in the middle of the exhibit. Executive Staff electrical closet - in the middle of the Executive offices.  ~~Promenade Deck~~ Queens Salon Switch - Left side back of stage, mounted on the wall. Passenger Info Booth Switch - Port Side (Dock side) Inside passenger info booth, under the main window.  Promenade Crawl Space - Half way up the stairs there is a crawl space. Located in the shopping area in the most centered area, behind the gift shop going toward the Observation Bar. Promenade Closet - Ports Side of Promenade Deck in a closet outside of the Regent Room. Royal Salon Kitchen Switch - In kitchen area behind the wall along the dishwasher.   ~~Main "M" Deck~~ Old Food and Beverage Managers Office Switch  - In the closet Port Side Britannia Electrical Closet Switch -Port side of Britannia entryway in the staff area Britannia Stage - Behind curtain of the Britannia Stage Starboard Side Switch 1 - In a closet next to room M025/027    ***Uses a VDSL Bridge to MDF*** Starboard Side Switch 2 - Next to room M121 Port Side Switch 1 - In a closet next to room M026-028 Port Side Switch  2 - Next to room M122  ~~A Deck~~ Admin Server Room Switch - In back of house behind the Front Desk AVMS Room Switch - In the AV room in the left hand side of the room mounted virtically to the wall.  Starboard Side Switch 1 - In closet next to room A015/017     ***Uses a VDSL Bridge to MDF*** Starboard Side Switch 2 -  In hatch next to room A131 Port Side Switch 1 - In closet next to room A018/016 Port Side Switch 2 - In hatch next to room A 132   ~~B Deck~~ Starboard Side Switch 1 - In closet next to room B325/327 Starboard Side Switch 2 - In hatch next to room B431 Port Side Switch 1 - In closet next to room B326/328 Port Side Switch 2 - In hatch next to room B430  Telco Switch - in the telephone room.  ~~R Deck~~ Grand Salon Switch - Hanging on the middle wall behind bronze glass doors along dance floor. Windsor Salon Switch - In storage closet next to main entrance. Above doorway on the left. AP is on top of Switch.  Aft Storage Room Switch - Found at the rear of the ship. The door leading to their room is between HR and the Laundry Room.  ~~D Deck~~ Exhibit Hall Switch - In the center of the room facing the Starboard side of the ship, high in the rafters. 4D Theater Switch - In hallway leading to the education "class" room, on the left the rack is just outside of the projector room. Bellman Closet Switch - In the Bellman closet up high by doorway. Bellman Switch - Located at the main entrance in the bellman closet behind the ticket booth and across from the elevators/stairway.  ~~Parking Lot~~ Production Office Switch 1 - Blue Building in parking lot. In the back room next to the ticket room. Production Office Switch 2 - Blue Building in parking lot. Up near the ceiling on the wall closest to the water. POE Switch - In the POE room located in the parking lot near the main entrance to the ship.
column68: If network equipment goes down you can contact the proprieties IT Staff.   ***Alert IT department of ISP issues. They can reboot the router if needed.***  Brandon Prach (Onsite IT) brandon.prach@queenmary.com           (562) 435-3511  IF FUSION FAILS, MOVE TRAFFIC OVER MIKROTIK: ------------------------------------------------------------------------- 1. Use Winbox software to log into the Mikrotik 98.168.114.14 (admin/GsquidPineapplejelly7&) 2. From the Mikrotik ssh into Core SW, run: "system ssh 172.16.60.10 user=admin" ----- and use the PW: lib3rty 3. Once on the CoreSW, disable the SW port when the Fusion LAN1 is (23) to ensure it won't be traffic over the Fusion. 4. Enable all the VLANs under the Interfaces menu under the VLAN tab. 5. On the IP menu, select the submenu Addresses, then select the interface "MGMT" and change the IP address from 172.16.60.254/24 to 172.16.60.1/24 6. Select the submenu DHCP Server on the IP menu and enable all the DHCP servers. Notes: - These are the VLANs currently configured in the Mikrotik: Convention WiFi, FAREHARBOR, Guest WiFi, MGMT, QM Admin, QM Special Events, ROAR_WiFi -In case a local connection is needed on the Mikrotik, please use ETH5/Local, make your PC static on 192.168.88.100/24, then type this IP 192.168.88.1 on the browser.  In order to access the IPMI via Mikrotik if FUSION is down, enable in Mikrotik IPMI-UPS Interface List (inside Mikrotik-->Interfaces/IPMI-UPS)

column66: The Hotel has been remolded, we have several guest rooms located in the Basement, Lover Level, 1st floor, 2nd floor and the 3rd floor.  The hotel uses Ubiquiti POE Switches and Ubiquiti AP.  AP's are located in every floor on each corner and one in the hallway.  Guest rooms have Samsung Hospitality TV's (Model HG50NT670U) with Spectrum STB with inferred.  STB is connected to HDMI1 and the Chromecast is connected to HDMI 2 and powered by the USB port on the TV.  The Remote used is the GuestCast remote that has been configured for Samsung TV's.  All chromecast devices are secured with a Metal braided cable.    Fusion is located in the MDF located in the basement, Wan 1 and IPMI are connected to port 3-4 on the Spectrum router. Lan 1 is connected to the Ubiquiti switch on Port 27, Lan2 is connected to the same switch on port 29.  Each guest room behind the TV we have a Cat 6 Ethernet cable

column66: This is a Ruckus in-room wifi deployment that uses POE type A connections. There are 3 models of APs at the location. H510s are in the living rooms of units and are installed on all floors. R510 (installed by another vendor) is located at the ends of the hallways on the even floors and in a storage room next to Studio x01 units. T310 is situated by the pool on the ceiling of the bathhouse over the water fountain.   There are 3 IDFs and an MDF. A fiber optic connection connects these.
column67: MDF - 2nd floor in the IT Staff room. This is where the Fusion, Core Switch, MikroTik Router Board, and WattBox are located. West IDF - West end of the building. Enter the space from outside. There is a cabinet rack with switches in it. 10G MM Fiber connection from MDF. East IDF - West end of the building. Enter the space from outside. There is a cabinet rack with switches in it. 10G MM Fiber connection from MDF. 18th FL IDF - Entrance is via the 18th floor door. Go upstairs. The room will be located at the top of the stairs. Has switch, R320s are located in the ceiling on the West and East ends of the hallways located in a panel in the ceiling. One is also located in the center in a closet the stacks above the MDF they are on Even floor 2 to 12 and 15th and 17th.   H510s - These are located in the living rooms. Even floors are in B units while Odd floors are in A units. The middle rooms of the B floors exception 17th are B  Ground Floor APs - R510s located in reception area ceiling, Fitness center & Biz Center.  BC drops - 5 of them VLAN 400 192.168.40.X
column68: There are 2 phone lines in each room. They are labeled in the phone rooms Room#A1 (Living Rm) Room#A2 (Bedroom); Rm#B1 (Lvgrm), Rm#B2 (Bdrm). Connections to the room were punched to A1 &B1 (living Rms) using only the orange and green wire pairs.  The site is now Daily Mgmt  IF FUSION FAILS, MOVE TRAFFIC OVER MIKROTIK: ------------------------------------------------------------------------- 1. Use Winbox software to log into the Mikrotik 24.120.252.229 (admin/GsquidPineapplejelly7&) 2. From the Mikrotik ssh into Core SW, run: "system ssh 172.16.61.10 user=admin" ----- and use the PW: SsquidPineapplejelly7& 3. Once you are on the CoreSW, disable the SW port when the Fusion LAN2 is (1/2/7) to make sure it won't be traffic over the Fusion. 4. Enable all the VLANs under the Interfaces menu, under the VLAN tab. 5. On the IP menu, select the submenu Addresses, then select the interface MGMT-VLAN100, and change the IP address from 172.16.61.254/24 to 172.16.61.1/24 6. Select the submenu DHCP Server on the IP menu and enable all the DHCP servers. Notes: - These are the VLANs currently configured in the Mikrotik: WiFI-MGMT, Biz-Center, Guest-WiFi. -In case a local connection is needed on the Mikrotik, please use ETH5/Local, make your PC static on 192.168.88.100/24, then type this IP 192.168.88.1 on the browser.

column66: This property has 4 buildings: Registration, Osprey, Crane, & Ibis. The MDF is located in the registration building and there is fiber linking the Crane and Ibis buildings back to registration. Osprey on the other hand is up-linked with an Ubiquiti Air Fiber P2P bridge that goes from crane master side to Osprey slave side. See Network diagram. Location is setup similarly to VV Parkway in that it's Ubiquiti bridges between buildings Crane and Osprey  that bridge the connection. Due to this, there can be interference in inclement weather.
column67: MDF is located behind FD Each of 3 Building has 2 IDF on the 4th floor One on low side in storage room near Trash drop feeding rooms 01 to 08 and the other on the high side feeding room 09 to 16. Each IDF has a 48 port and a 24 port Switch. there are H500s mounted above the drop ceiling in each Guest Room Foyer. Fiber feeds from Core SW to Crane via fiber box on 1st floor to fiber box on 2nd floor to box in Housekeeping closet on 4th floor SW-Crane-IDF-1-4-1 port 52 fiber feeds from Core SW to Ibis via box on 2nd floor to box in 4th floor Housekeeping closet SW-Ibis-IDF-1-4-1 port 52 SW-Crane-IDF-2-4-1 port 46 feeds P2P-1-8-S-Osprey [Master] located on the roof outside on parapet facing Osprey P2P-2-7-R-Crane [Slave] is located on the roof of Osprey and feeds SW-Osprey-IDF-2-4-1 port 46 The R500 for the lobby is located in the MDF The T300 for the pool area is located high on outside wall of Registration Building facing the main pool. 2 extra AP has been installed on the Osprey building on the 7th and the 6th floor for the inventory offices by the elevator in the hallway drop ceiling.
column68: The primary fiber uplink (WAN4) is handed off to us from a switch on the admin network.  We receive this handoff on our core switch (172.16.0.10) port 1/4/4 (untagged VLAN 902) from a Cisco switch on the admin network with a hostname of "ciscoSG500stack" on port te2/1/1 which is untagged (native) VLAN 40 on their end. The Comcast feed connects to port XG2 on the Cisco switch. Keep in mind that if WAN4 goes offline the point of failure could be this admin switch.  The best contact to troubleshoot issues with this switch on the admin network is Wayne Mercer wmercer@dmresorts.com. - Updated by Walter 4/18/22 As per Wayne Nick Murphy no longer works here.   If there is any major network issue at the property then an email should be sent to  aonorato@dmresorts.com and support@dmresorts.com letting them know what is going on.  This includes ISP techs being dispatched to the property.  Ping Watchdog is running on the P2Ps. See the file "P2P Ping Watchdog Notes VV Weston" in the Network Diagram section of Docs.

column66: This is a Zebra-Motorola VDSL project. There are 3DSLAMs & 45 X TW522s(mostly) and TW511s.  DSLAM-1 and DSLAM-3 are US region. In case of DSLAM-2 is WR region, so make sure all the CPEs on it have to be WR version. See network diagram or EquipList for locations. Per client requests transmit power on APs was turned down to 1/2 power.
column67: MDF - Main Bldg telco room. Rack contains Fusion, core switch, DSLAMs & WattBox ISP Modem - Located upstairs in copier room. There is a wall mounted rack where the modem is located. A single CAT5 cable brings data down to MDF.  APs -  Townhouses - Located on wall in downstairs living room. DSL filter is located in upstairs bedroom A. Guest Rooms - Located in room on phone jack.
column68: Wifi signal from APs is turned down to 1/2 power per client request. They do not want wifi signal and connectivity in the public spaces. IT contact , Lisa, is aware of the effect to guest rooms doing this will have. Lisa called on 6/19/2016 asking to lower even more the Tx power on all the CPE's. She said we should contact her in the event that we are unable to get someone connected to WiFi.  If a guest is calling in about content filtering and the you are unfamiliar with the website, or you are not sure if it would be okay to pass through, direct the guest to speak with one of the front desk agents, and ask for permission from them.   When contacting Lisa please call her rather than through email.   IF FUSION FAILS, MOVE TRAFFIC OVER TO EDGEROUTER: ------------------------------------------------------------------------- 1. Connect to the EdgeRouter using your web browser. 2. Open the EdgeRouter CLI by clicking on the CLI button found on the top right of the web user interface. 3. Ssh into the Core Switch(172.16.0.2) from the EdgeRouter terminal. 4. Disable port 1/1/10, which is connected to the Fusion LAN2 (This eliminates the LAN traffic to hit the Fusion) 5. On the EdgeRouter dashboard, enable all the VLANs using the "Actions" button to the right of each VLAN. 6. Using the "Actions: button, edit the VLAN 100 and change the EdgeRouter IP address from 172.16.0.250/24 to 172.16.0.1/24. 7. Under the "Services" tab, enable the DHCP server named "Management-VLAN100 using the "Actions" button. Notes: - These are the VLANs currently configured in the EdgeRouter: Management-VLAN100, Guest_wifi-VLAN1000

column66: This is a Ruckus install with a ZD1200. There are APs connected via a Motorola TW-510 CPE in rooms on the 3rd floor. Then there are APs powered by POE in the basement under lobby and lobby level rooms. The gateway is a Fusion and there is a Core Switch. There is a GuestCast Server in the MDF and each room's TV has a Chromcast Device connected to HDMI2 and powered from the TVs USB port.     Of note is that WLANs "Spindrift Wifi' and "btvcasting" are tunneled in the ZD1200.

AP's are located in the rooms, under the beds on the walls, in every other room on each side of the hallway 3rd floor. AP's are located on floors 3 and in the basement under the lobby level rooms. The is one outdoor AP mounted on the 3rd floor stair landing on the east side stairs.

column66: The ISP services are DSL Modems.  The static ISP /30 (Secondary) goes to LAN2 (WAN3) on the FUSION through the Core-SW (in-Port 1/1/17, out-Port 1/1/21 ) The DHCP ISP (Primary)  goes direct to direct to the FUSION on WAN2  WAPs Common areas are powered via Cat6 from Core-SW, including Santa Cruz Meeting Room.  WAPs in Conference rooms are powered via Cat6 from SW-IDF-1-01 (Capitola, Summit-I y Summit-II).   There are two switches that also provide Ethernet ports on the meeting room tables in the Santa Cruz and PDR rooms and are connected back to the Core switch in the Garage. These are on their own VLAN 201. ******During the last update were not found******  In April 24 ttwo IDFs were created to give connection to the Chef's Office in the restaurant and to provide connection for two new APs in the restaurant.

column30: This site is a BTV 390 with Chromcast IPTV solution.  Each bungalows has its own fiber connection which in turn is connected to a GPon Fiber to Ethernet converter. Please see photos.  BTV 390 is connected to HDMI 1 on the Back of the Samsung TV.  Please note we are not using any MPI cables on this project.  Chromecast is connected to the STB 390 and plugged into a power strip with 6 outlets.  The HDMI cables, Ethernet Cable and power cables are all running behind the wall to bottom into a White junction box.  Please see photos. Too access samsung Menu you will need original remote and then select menu-119-enter.  Gpon CPE is a Ubiquiti UFiber Nano G. Please see photo  Also the HDMI cables are a little short, so they will need to be disconnected first before removal of the TV from the wall.    For the Guest to Cast to the TV, the guest must connect there device to the SSID in the Room ie CastingRoom number (Casting143).  The Bungalows are secured via mac isolation so no one can cast to another TV.    The ISP feed to the property is located in the Telco room in the Clubhouse, The MDF headend for TV service and the Fusion is located in the commissary.  The site has two circuits in a failover setup.  Primary circuit is ATT secondary circuit is Cox .
column66: The network is a Ubiquity setup with a fiber connection to all bungalows.  There is 2 Ubiquity 10G Switches, one in the MDF located in the reception office and the other in the MDF Headend located in the commissary.  All Bungalows fiber connections all come out of the MDF/Headend, our Fusion, Verimatrix and Com 2000 are also located here.   Each bungalow is feed via single mode fiber connected to a Ubiquity GPON fiber to Ethernet transceiver.  Then an Ethernet cable is connected to the AP in the room located under the desk.
column67: STB with chromecast are located in the Bungalows behind the wall under the TV.    There is 138 Bungalows with Samsung 55" TV's and 2 Pool Cabanas located at the Main pool by the spa.  The STB in the bungalows are located behind the Wall under the TV  (Please see photos in CRM).  In the Cabanas the STB are located in the Attic above the TV, Attic access is available in the IDF which is located next to the Cabana and Spa.  The Chromecast in the bungalows are directly connect to the STB, we can not connect the Chromcast to the Samsung TV due to all cables are running behind the wall and the distance is to great to utilize the USB port on the TV for power.    The Main Fiber and the Roll over connection are located in the MDF/ Reception office.  Currently feeding the Property via fiber is ATT and Comcast.  ATT is the Primary circuit which is 1G/1G, the Comcast is the backup circuit which is currently 100/100.
column68: At this site we only have BTV 390 with Chromecast, we do not handle the Guest Wi-Fi that is handled by Custom Cable.  There is 138 Bungalows with Samsung 55" TV's and 2 Pool Cabanas located at the Main pool by the spa.  The STB in the bungalows are located behind the Wall under the TV  (Please see photos in CRM).  In the Cabanas the STB are located in the Attic above the TV, Attic access is available in the IDF which is located next to the Cabana and Spa.  The Chromecast in the bungalows are directly connect to the STB, we can not connect the Chromecast to the Samsung TV due to all cables are running behind the wall and the distance is to great to utilize the USB port on the TV for power.    All the Bungalows are connected via single Mode fiber via a GPON switch that all run from the MDF Headend which is located in the commissary. Under the Desk in the Bungalows is where the Ubiquity AP is located, the device has two ethernet ports.  One for the VOIP Phones and the other for an Ethernet connection out to the internet.  Our Fusion and Vermatrix server along with the Com 2000 Rack are located here as well.    The Main Fiber and the Roll over connection are located in the MDF/ Reception office.  Currently feeding the Property via fiber is ATT and Comcast.  ATT is the Primary circuit which is 1G/1G, the Comcast is the backup circuit which is currently 100/100.  Please note that the Bungalows is upgrading there roll over circuit (Comcast) to a 1G/1G. The fail over plan is setup to ping the main gateway from ATT continuously ever 3 min, if the ATT gateway is not reachable with in those 3 min the Fail over circuit (comcast) will come online. When the Primary circuit is back online the internet routes will move back to the Primary provider ATT.  Guest Casting to the TV- A isolated SSID for every bungalow has been created for example ( if a guest is in room 101, the guest will see a SSID called casting101.)  the guest must connect to this SSID to successfully cast to the TV.  Please note that the SSID in isolated via mac address, being that said that the guest in room 101 can only cast to the TV in this room.  Even if the guest see the SSID for the next door Bungalow like room 102, the guest in room 101 can not connect to that device in room 102.  Samsung TV configuration- we need to change the Hospitality mode from interactive to standalone.  The Tech will need a Samsung remote to access the Hospitality menu.  You can access this menu by pressing Mute+119+enter and that will bring up the menu.  the first line is hospitality mode, to change from interactive to standalone you must use the arrow keys on the remote to change the selection.  once the selection has been changed please select the return button the remote, once that has been done you will need to turn off the TV and wait 5 seconds and then turn on the tv.  This process saves the configuration for the Samsung TV.  1/28/2020 - NEW SWITCH WAS ADDED ssh - Only UN: admin PW: Bung@l0w$ We have installed a Brocade 7450 for 3 - 10G Moduales as the new Core sw to handle the IPTV and Chromecast devices.  The IP for the SW is 172.17.0.10. If you need to get a hold of Jalie with Custom cable his cell number is 1-305-467-6927.  To access the gates to get into the compound and the commissary where the MDF is located the code for the Gate is 9901#, a copy of the Config for the SW has been uploaded to CRM  Groove provides the FTG DISH Network / TV Provider Groove Technology Solutions 6849 S 700 W #100, Midvale, UT 84047 https://www.getgrooven.com/ Montana Lyon (Tier 3 Video Technical Support) +1 801 994 3642 - Main Tech Support Number +1 801-897-9647 - Direct contact info. montana@getgrooven.com

column68: Still on Installation process  IF FUSION FAILS, MOVE TRAFFIC OVER MIKROTIK: ------------------------------------------------------------------------- 1. Use Winbox software to log into the Mikrotik 65.242.20.83 (admin/GsquidPineapplejelly7&) 2. From the Mikrotik ssh into Core SW, run: "system ssh 172.16.0.10 user=admin" ----- and use the PW: SsquidPineapplejelly7& 3. Once on the CoreSW, disable the SW port when the Fusion LAN2 is (1/1/48) to ensure it won't be traffic over the Fusion. 4. Enable all the VLANs under the Interfaces menu under the VLAN tab. 5. On the IP menu, select the submenu Addresses, then select the interface "MGMT-VLAN100" and change the IP address from 172.16.0.254/24 to 172.16.0.1/24 6. Select the submenu DHCP Server on the IP menu and enable all the DHCP servers. Notes: - These are the VLANs currently configured in the Mikrotik: MGMT-VLAN100,GuestWifi-VLAN200, ConferenceWifi-VLAN300, ConferenceHardWire-VLAN301, VLAN 999 -In case a local connection is needed on the Mikrotik, please use ETH5/Local, make your PC static on 192.168.88.100/24, then type this IP 192.168.88.1 on the browser.

column66: WiFi Upgrade January 2025 --------------------------------------- This is a Three story building "C" shape, it has a Patio with a Pool. We Installed Common Areas APs (GM-Office, Landing Elevators, Pool Area, BBQ Area) also APs inside the Guest Rooms. All the APs are PoE form either MDF or IDF (See equipment List for details). We installed MDF and IDF linked via SM Fiber also installed by us. SWs are Brocade. APs are Unbranded.  This is our 1st Open WiFi network. Using unbranded APs, the WLC is a VM built on under Fusion Virtualization. It's designed to Manage the Wireless Network from Fusion: Network / Wireless. The WLC is a VMW in sync with the Fusion.  Only One SSID was created for Guest Network, on VLAN200 with Splash Page from Fusion, access code login option.   DSLAMs were disconnected on 01-24-2025 The CPEs were left installed on the rooms, we put Metal clips on the 2x 66 Blocks.
column67: WiFi Upgrade January 2025 --------------------------------------- - MDF is located in GM's office. 1st Floor in front of Guest Elevator. -- Fusion, Mikrotik, Wattbox, Core SW is located in GM's office left side on the 1st FL   -IDF, UPS is located in a closet towards back of the property 2nd FL next to Room 212  OLD System Before January 2025 WiFi Upgrade ---------------------------------------------------------------- The MDF(Fusion, core switch, DSLAMs, & WPS) is located in accounting office. The 66 blocks are located in a closet across the hall from accounting. All the TW-511 CPE/APs are located either in the bedroom or living room. There is also a T300 for the pool in the wall right outside the FD area.
column68: WiFi Upgrade January 2025 ------------------------------------  --------------------------------------------------------- ----- AP Basic Troubleshoouting steps  -----  ---------------------------------------------------------  WLC is installed in Virtual Machine on the Fusion GW, All AP, SSID, Groups configuratin is managed by the Fusion.  Going to: Network>>Wireless you can manage APs, Groups and SSID:  - In the WLAN scalfod you can see the SSID's configured for the Property. - In the Access Points scalfold you will see a list of All APs of the property with the clients connected to it, for each AP you will be able to perform actions like reboot or see the clients connected to it.  ---------------------------------------------------------  -In case Fusion Fail we also configured a Port-FW on the Mikrotik, but it won't work until IP address on VLAN 100 got changed from 172.16.0.254 to 172.16.0.1 currently configured on Fusion. https://50.146.159.93:60019  - IDF power is controlled by a light switch, If the power switch is off no power is in that closet (Maintenance is aware of the issue and will separate current)    ********************************************************************************************** ******** IN CASE OF FUSION FAILURE MOVE TRAFFIC OVER MIKROTIK ******* ********************************************************************************************** 1. Use Winbox software to log into the Mikrotik 50.146.159.93 (admin/GsquidPineapplejelly7&) 2. From the Mikrotik ssh into Core SW, Open New Terminal CLI: "system ssh user=your-radius-user 172.16.0.20 " ----- and the PW: your-radius-password 3. Once on the CoreSW, disable the SW port when the Fusion-LAN1 (port 1/1/18) is to ensure it won't be traffic over the Fusion. 4. On the IP menu, select the submenu Addresses, then select "MGMT172.16.0.254/24-VLAN-100" and change the IP address from 172.16.0.254/24 to 172.16.0.1/24 5. Enable all the VLANs under the Interfaces menu under the VLAN tab. 6. Select the submenu Addresses List on the IP menu and enable all the Addresses. 7. Select the submenu DHCP Server on the IP menu and enable all the DHCP servers.  Notes: - These are the VLANs currently configured in the Mikrotik: 200 -In case a local connection is needed on the Mikrotik, please use ETH5/Local, make your PC static on 192.168.88.100/24, then type this IP 192.168.88.1 on the browser. **************************************************************************************************

column66: This is a take over property: -We added a Fusion to handle all the traffic. -We kept the UDM to manage the WiFi, APs and SWs. (APs and SWs are unifi) -We added a Mikrotik as a Backup Gateway. (Tested onsite) -We added a WattBox  - Wired ports: The ports are currently on the Vietta-Staff VLAN. Network: 192.168.30.0. The cables are connected to Switch 1.1  -  Ports 1 to 5.  The property is a single building with two floors divided into two sections, in the center of the two sections are cat walk where the AP and the air conditioning units are located. It has a swimming pool where there is an AP pointing directly to it.  HIS Single Family Property (Acquisition) ------------------------------------ 2-story building.  We offer WiFi in common areas and guest units. They have a total of 81 Gest Rooms.  The Uplink between MDF and IDFs is MMF-OM3 (Unifi Network) Switches are Unifi 48 Port and 24 Port. UDM are cloud managed --- Unifi Cloud Controller (Site Vietta).  Equipment installed: - FUSION - MIKROTIK - WATTBOX
column67: MDF:  Located on the second floor in maintenance storage  IDF: Located on the second floor inside the linen room.  APs: The APs that send signals to the rooms are located in the cat walk (corridors located in the center of the back to back rooms), to access them it is necessary to enter the maintenance and linen storage areas.  Wired Ports: Five wired ports were installed in the office area for the administration computers, one of which is directly connected to the printer located inside the GM office.
column68: WattBox port mapping: -------------------------------------------- 1. Fusion. 2. Empty 3. ISP Modem (Coax cable input) 4. Mikrotik 5. ISP Router (Cat6 handoff) ---------------------------------------------  ********************************************************************************************* ******** IN CASE OF FUSION FAILURE MOVE TRAFFIC OVER MIKROTIK ******* ********************************************************************************************** 1. Move cat6 cable form Fusion-LAN1 to Mikrotik-ETH3... to provide Internet access to the UDM (port9) 2. Use Winbox software to log into the Mikrotik 71.42.34.156 (admin/GsquidPineapplejelly7&) 3. On the IP menu, select the submenu Addresses, Enable Address 192.168.1.1/24 4. On the IP menu, select the submenu DHCP Servers, Enable DHCP-UDM-WAN --- this will bring the UDM online 5. Now the Dream Machine (UDM) should be online and accessible: Then disable the SW port where the Fusion-LAN2 (SW 1.3 port 20) to ensure it won't be traffic over the Fusion. 6. On the IP menu, select the submenu Addresses, then select "10.2.1.253/24" and change the IP address from 10.2.1.253/24 to 10.2.1.254/24 7. Enable all the VLANs under the Interfaces menu under the VLAN tab. 8. Select the submenu Addresses List on the IP menu and enable all the Addresses. 9. Select the submenu DHCP Server on the IP menu and enable all the DHCP servers.  Notes: - These are the VLANs currently configured in the Mikrotik: 10, 20, 30, 52 -In case a local connection is needed on the Mikrotik, please use ETH5/Local, make your PC static on 192.168.88.100/24, then type this IP 192.168.88.1 on the browser. **************************************************************************************************.

column66: Single-Bldg. MDU Property: ------------------------------------ 5 Story Bldg. (Basement, 1 to 4 plus Roof).  We provide WiFi in Common areas and residents units. We also provide Hardwired connection to residents in their own bedrooms. They have a total of 28 Units, every unit has between 4 and 6 bedrooms.  All the Uplink between MDF and IDFs are SMF (Brocade Network).  Every hardwired connection per bedroom has a unique private vlan assigned.    TPLink SWs are cloud managed --- Omada Cloud Controller Cambium APs  are cloud managed --- Cambium Cloud Controller.  We have integrated the Fusion with a Reservation Management System called Entrata to create a DPSK per Resident Bedroom.   We have integrated the Fusion with our Cambium Cloud Controller (Only the corresponding Side/Property) to have the WLAN "4339 Berryman Residents" use the Fusion Radius Server.  We deployed: TPLink SWs in every unit (Media Box Panel inside the Closet). Every media box panel contains: *1x TPLink PoEin-POEout-5P power up from Brocade SW *1x TPLink PoEin-nonPoEout-8P power up from TPLink above. This provides Hardwired Connection to every Bedroom on that unit. *1x 12P Cat6 Patch Panel where converges all the in bedroom hardwired connections.   Clients Experience: ----------------------------- As initial configuration, we created Three SSIDs: * 4339 Berryman Residents --- Designed for Residents to have their private network (specific VLAN from 201 to 358). No Portal Page. Every resident will be provided with a Pre-Shared Key generated on the Fusion. No portal page. This network is accessible property-wide. * Peak --- Created for Satff --- Clients will use a WPA2: L3@$ing! (This is Peakmade standard) using VLAN (401). No portal page. This network is accessible property-wide. * 4339 Berryman Guest --- Created for Fusion Fail purposes only. --- Clients will use WPA2: 4339Gues$t! using VLAN (200). No portal page. Currently Hidden and Disabled, see Troubleshooting Notes to bring it alive.

column68: *********Site is in the process of transitioning management companies over to UCLA Housing*********  ********************************************************************************************* ******** IN CASE OF FUSION FAILURE MOVE TRAFFIC OVER MIKROTIK ******* ********************************************************************************************** 1. Use Winbox software to log into the Mikrotik 76.53.75.228 (admin/GsquidPineapplejelly7&) 2. From the Mikrotik ssh into Core SW, Open New Terminal CLI: "system ssh user=your-radius-user 172.16.0.10 " ----- and the PW: your-radius-password 3. Once on the CoreSW, disable the SW port when the Fusion-LAN2 (port 1/2/4) is to ensure it won't be traffic over the Fusion. 4. On the IP menu, select the submenu Addresses, then select "MGMT 172.16.0.254/24-VLAN-100" and change the IP address from 172.16.0.254/24 to 172.16.0.1/24 5. Enable all the VLANs under the Interfaces menu under the VLAN tab. 6. Select the submenu Addresses List on the IP menu and enable all the Addresses. 7. Select the submenu DHCP Server on the IP menu and enable all the DHCP servers. 8. Login to the Cambium Cloud Controller: Enable and Make visible the SSID "4339 Berryman Guest" --- Property needs to be provided with the corresponding WAP2. Notes: - These are the VLANs currently configured in the Mikrotik: 100, 200 and 401 -In case a local connection is needed on the Mikrotik, please use ETH5/Local, make your PC static on 192.168.88.100/24, then type this IP 192.168.88.1 on the browser. **************************************************************************************************. column66: There are 29 root and 2 mesh APs. The upper property is connected by a Cat6 back bone coming from the Main Building MDF (Core Switch). All APs in the upper property (the Mansion and Cottages) are POE.    The Main building and Villa (next to each other, have mainly 7363 dual band APs and a few 7372s. The upper property is all 7372s. The Villa rooms on the north side are connected via MOCA over the TV Cables. There is a small WAN network consisting of three switches. Tere are two WAN switches in the MDF. One supplies feeds to the Fusion, Security camera, and admin system. The second WAN switch in the MDF feeds a third WAN switch in the Mansion IDF. The Mansion IDF WAN switch provides feeds for the VIP suit's AV system and for the Conference rooms AV system.   There is also an Admin Back bone that goes to the Mansion IDF and there is an Admin switch there as well.

column68: IF FUSION FAILS, MOVE TRAFFIC OVER TO EDGEROUTER: ------------------------------------------------------------------------- 1. Connect to the EdgeRouter using your web browser. 2. Open the EdgeRouter CLI by clicking on the CLI button found on the top right of the web user interface. 3. Ssh into the Core Switch(172.16.16.10) from the EdgeRouter terminal. 4. Disable port 1/1/44, which is connected to the Fusion LAN2 (This eliminates the LAN traffic to hit the Fusion) 5. On the EdgeRouter dashboard, enable all the VLANs using the "Actions" button to the right of each VLAN. 6. using the "Actions: button, edit the VLAN 100 and change the EdgeRouter IP address from 172.16.16.254/24 to 172.16.16.1/24. 7. Under the "Services" tab, enable the DHCP server named "MGMT-VLAN100" using the "Actions" button. Notes: - These are the VLANs currently configured in the EdgeRouter: MGMT 100, GuestWiFi 200, LobbyWiFi 202, Graduate-Associates 800

column66: We have taken over the property. It is going to be installed in 2 phases.   Phase 1: Public spaces Phase 2: Guest rooms  Phase1: Installed Fusion, New ZD, Core Switch, 2nd floor IDF switch, WPS  Light up and tested all the public spaces with R500s. Signal is averaging from -30 to -60 dBi on both bands. All WAPs feed back to the core switch  Phase2: For that phase we will need H500s and 2 more 48-port PoE switches in the IDF of the second floor. Patch cords are in the IDF waiting to be used.  Phase 2 was installed and we ended up installing the two new switches plus an additional existing 3500 switch for phone only ******OLD DATA******  We help perform basic configuration on the Fusion. Beyond that, we were not involved in the design or installation of this network.  Here are the few known we have:  We created L3 client isolation by creating 1024 /32 subnets on the guest network.  The biz center components are staticed to their own subnet so that the printer can be seen by the computer.  We are connecting to the PMS through a switch that is part of their admin network.  *****************

column66: There is only 1 data closet for the whole property. Everything runs from it.   We are used as converged network provider. We not only provide Wi-Fi, but the backbone for IPTV network. Every switch installed is PoE+ Switch. All WAPs feed from the MDF. All the smart TVs are also fed from our switches.  ONLY 2.4 GHz coverage at the property. DO NOT turn on 5 GHz radios as there is not sufficient coverage, unless instructed otherwise.

column66: This is a large property with 3 Guest room towers, and a large casino area: Towers: Ivory - Hotel rooms Fantasy - Hotel Romms Palms Place - Condominiums The Fusions and Mikrotik routers are off-site at the Switchnap data center. The property has a dedicated connection between the admin network and the data center. All our VLANs are passing through this connection, and we have a handoff at our core switch in the MDF. There is also a handoff from Cox in the MDF. Corporate & Cox SSIDs are using dry VLANs that we hand off back to them through our core switch. There are Cox STBs in the rooms, which either connect to the in-room AP or to the IDF switch for COX L2 connectivity. There are Bartech Zigbee APs in some rooms, which either connect to the in-room AP or to the IDF switch for the L2 connectivity.  Casino and Common Areas	AP-MGMT-1	VLAN701	10.244.140.0/23 Fantasy Tower	AP-MGMT-2	VLAN702	10.244.142.0/23 Ivory Tower	AP-MGMT-3	VLAN703	10.244.144.0/23 Plams Place	AP-MGMT-4	VLAN704	10.244.146.0/23 Property Wide	SW-MGMT	VLAN705	172.16.0.0/23 Peering Network Radius/PMS/Syslog Server	VLAN706	10.244.6.56/29  Equipment List Link: https://hotelinternetservices.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/HIS/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7BDD19569F-584B-468F-BBB0-087554528284%7D&file=The%20Palms%20-%20Equipment%20List%2020%20August%202015.xlsx&action=default&mobileredirect=true  SharePoint Folder: https://hotelinternetservices.sharepoint.com/sites/HIS/04%20%20OPERATIONS/Forms/AllItems.aspx?id=%2Fsites%2FHIS%2F04%20%20OPERATIONS%2FProperties%2FVegas%2FThe%20Palms%20Casino%20Resort&view=0
column67: Fusions and Mikrotik Backup routers are off-property in the Switchnap data center in Las Vegas. The MDF is in the basement of the Ivory tower (Stacked Ruckus ICX 7850-48), and there is a fiber hub in a nearby room called Music and Page. The Fantasy tower has an IDF on each floor, while the Ivory tower has two main IDFs (4th and 54th floors) The casino and common area IDFs are spread out throughout Common area access points are normally found in the ceiling, while in-room APs are normally found behind the TV or inside the closet

column66: ----------------------------------------------------------2025------------------------------------------------------------ ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- This property run under Unifi Network. Four Unify controllers (UDMs) manage all the Unifiy switches (44), the Unify APs and the Unify cameras in all the property. The old Samsung controller was in the basement MDF with Nomadix Gateway and Core switch, all these devices are discontinued.  They are using a combination of hotel fiber, and  P2P  to connect IDFs.  The Tower has Two IDFs are on floors: Both IDFs are in the staff elevator hallway. ***4Th floor IDF --- > Hosting the 4th floor SW and the 6th floor SW, they provide to APs from the 3rd to 7th floor. ***10th floor IDF --- > Hosting  the 10th floor SW and the 12th floor SW, they provide to APs from 8th to 12th floor.  Each UDM reach its own SWs through a Ruckus CoreSW, see the Network Diagram for details.  The property also has 22 bungalows, they are connected to the Cottage USW-Pro-Aggregation switch in the MDF using fiber.  At least  three of the bungalows have a secondary backup wireless link (P2P) in case the primary link (fiber) fails.   At this point (02/14/2025): *UDMs manage the APs and SWs networks. *UDM Property manage and provide DHCP for Sign Network *The rest of the networks are running through the Fusion (Default Gateway and DHCP) *We left a SonicWall online and accessible, in case it has to be used then it has to be configured.   Notes: At this point (02/14/2025): 1. Automatic updates should be disabled to avoid reset some devices after applying them 2. Some devices need be the reset to be adopted in the controller --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
